N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6171.4 - Approval

State Regulations
(a) The
commissioner of the Division of Criminal Justice Services in consultation with
the Crime Victims Board shall select programs for funding pursuant to this Part
and shall determine the amount of funds to be disbursed for each program within
available appropriations. (b) In
addition to the preference pursuant to section
6171.3
(b) of this

Part, the selection process shall require, but not be limited to, consideration
of these factors: (1)
the need for the
program in the geographical area served or to be served; (2)
the availability of other sources of
funding; (3)
whether such program
is likely to ensure the availability of victims or witnesses to provide
information to law enforcement in the investigation and/or prosecution of
relevant crime or crimes; (4)
the
established cooperation and coordination with the components of the criminal
justice system (i.e., police, district attorneys, courts, etc.); (5)
the established cooperation and
coordination with other service providers within the service area; (6)
how the nature of the services to be
rendered will enhance existing witness protection efforts; (7)
the nature of the services to be
rendered, the target population to be served by such services, and the cost
associated with rendering such services; (8)
the ability of applicant to administer
the program; (9)
the qualifications
and relevant experience of personnel administering the program (e.g., board of
directors), and the personnel staffing the program; (10)
the adequacy and costs of program
facilities; and
(11)
established
fiscal controls which guarantee the proper handling and recording of program
funds. Notes
